Context:
The Office of Academic Excellence (OAE) at George Brown College is dedicated to improving student learning and ensuring graduates have the necessary knowledge and skills for their future careers. Their work values include maintaining compliance with external academic quality standards, continuously improving college programs, policies, and processes, and aligning curriculum with external/internal standards. The OAE has four main areas of responsibility: overall process, academic program revision/renewal, curriculum development, and academic policy development and renewal. These areas aim to ensure the college's compliance with academic quality standards, provide a formal and systematic process for program decisions, lead and influence curriculum development, and administer an integrated academic policy framework.
